title.narrative: CRS - Multisectoral Assistance in the Kasais
CRS - Multisectoral Assistance in the Kasais

description.narrative: The intervention is multi-sectorial and aim to reach 99 villages with integrated development package. The packages largely aim at reducing food insecurity from an agricultural perspective but also addresses livelihoods, nutritional needs, gender issues and social cohesion aspects. The global objective is the revival of sustainable agriculture, essential to reduce poverty, to ensure food and nutritional security for the populations of 99 villages of Lupatapata (in the Mukumbi health zone) and to generate sustainable jobs and income. More specifically, three major priority areas have been identified: Communities are equipped to maintain social cohesion. (ii) Communities adopt improved nutritional practices and produce more food for consumption and sale. (iii) 99 villages prioritize gender inclusion at community and household level. The activities (i) will help the communities to establish or reactivate their Community Animation Cell, to develop a set of key village development plans and to connect the communities to the main government services and structures. These activities will provide the foundations for villages and their members to describe and implement a shared vision for their village and establish renewed and strengthened relationships with key local government stakeholders. Households adopt improved agricultural practices to increase production. The project will support smallholder farmers in each village to organize themselves into PO (producer organisation) using training on the CRS SMART Skills curriculum. SMART Skills teach farmers a range of skills to improve their livelihoods, including how to organize into groups, use natural resources sustainably, market produce profitably, manage finances, and save money and organize credit, all while identifying, testing and adopting innovations. SMART Skills enables farmers to make the most of their resources and to prepare for recurrent shocks and chronic stresses. The SMART curriculum is skills-based and organizes these topics under five key skills: (Group management/organization, Natural Resource Management, Finance, Marketing, Innovation). Communities promote gender inclusion in governance activities: CRS will seek greater female participation across SO1 activities by including the training of “Gender Champions” to act as community-level advocates for increased awareness of issues relating to gender equality. The 198 Gender Champions - a man and woman nominated by each of the 99 target villages’ CAC in consultation with the village chief - will participate in a three-day training in Mbuji Mayi on topics including SGBV prevention, the importance of joint decision making among couples, changing norms around child and forced marriage, among other topics identified during the gender analysis included in the baseline assessement.

Befolkningen i Lupatatapa ligger i provinsen Kasai Oriantal där befolkningen dör av undernäring trots det potentiella jordbruket, dess bördiga mark och mineraler, främst diamanter.
Trots jordbrukspotentialen och mineralerna finns det en utbredd kronisk fattigdom och brist på kunskap om provinsens potential vad gäller jordbruk, boskap och fiske.
Provinserna kännetecknas av dålig infrastruktur (obefintlig väg) med ett ineffektivt och transportsystem som följd.
Catholics Relief Resources (CRS) bad Sida om ett bidrag på 55 696 948 SEK svenska kronor för aktuellt projekt under perioden 2021-2024.
Interventionen är ett multisektoriellt biståndsprojekt som främst syftar till att återinföra hållbara jordbruk för att förbättra inkomsterna för samhällen som bor i 99 byar på Lupatapatas territorium. Grödorna som omfattas är majs, soja, sötpotatis, moringa och även fjäderfäuppfödning avses inkluderas.
CRS kommer inte att vara begränsat till jordbruk utan istället anta en helhetssyn avseende jordbruk och utveckling av till utsatta människors basgemenskap, dvs. byar.
För CRS, om vi stärker samhällen i ett integrerat tillvägagångssätt för social integration, samhällsstyrning, hållbar jordbruksproduktion och försörjning, kan de 99 riktade byarna ha bättre livsmedelssäkerhet.
CRS kommer att samarbeta med lokala icke-statliga organisationer och överföra färdigheter till dem på ett ansvarsfullt sätt med teknisk övervakning. CRS kommer att tillämpa metoden "Hoppa inte över byar, glöm inte byar, skada inte eller skapa nya obalanser mellan byar." CRS kommer att utveckla kopplingen byarnas koppling mellan varandra vad gäller styrning och och samarbeten mellan statssektorerna och de olika grupper av producenter.
Betoning kommer att läggas på att kvinnor inkluderas i styrelseformer och i alla utvecklingsaktiviteter.
De förväntade resultaten är: - Gemenskaperna ska bli utrustade för att upprätthålla social sammanhållning. - Styrelsestrukturer på gemenskapsnivå ska stärkas, bli aktiva och kopplade till statliga tjänster - Hushållen ska använda förbättrade näringsmetoder. Samhällen ska producera mer mat för konsumtion och försäljning. - Gemenskaper ska mobilisera resurser för att få tillgång till näringsrik mat. - De berörda 99 byarna ska prioritera genderfrågor på samhälls- och hushållsnivå.
Den totala budgeten för insatsen är 56 880 281 SEK, varav Sida bidrar med 55 696 948 SEK (6 825 634 USD) för genomförandet av insatsen under perioden 2021-2024, 98% av den totala budgeten. Resten av budgeten 1 183 333 , (2%), kommer att finansieras av CRS. Sida fortsätter dialogen innan avtalet undertecknas för att säkerställa att CRS kommer att bidra med upp till 2%.CRS's bidrag kommer att användas specifikt för att genomföra operativ forskning för att mäta effekterna av social sammanhållningsprogrammering som ingår i Tudikolela-projektet.

The population of Lupatatapa is very poor and is located in the Province of Kasai Oriantal where population is dying with malnutrition despite the potential agriculture, its fertile lands and minerals, mainly diamonds.
Despite the agricultural potential and minerals, there is widespread chronic poverty and a lack of knowledge on organizational potential, insufficient opportunity, lack of knowledge on the nutritional potential of the province through agriculture, livestock and fisheries. Low purchasing power and limited access to foods poor. The provinces are characterized by poor infrastructure (non-existent of roads), resulting in the lack of an effective and efficient transport system and crippling the performance of small farmers.
This province was an agricultural granary which served all the neighboring towns and even the province of Katanga.
Catholics Relief Resources (CRS) asked Sida 55 696 948 Swedish crowns to carry out the Tudikolela project, which means we are progressing and where we are evolving in the DRC, in the province of Kasai Oriental (Lupatapata territory in Kasai Oriental 30 km from the city of Mbuji Mayi) during the period 2021-2024.
The intervention is a multisectoral assistance project which mainly aims to relaunch sustainable agriculture to improve the income of communities living in 99 villages in the territory of Lupatapata. The crops to be revived are corn, soya, sweet potatoes, moringa and poultry farming.
CRS will not be limited to agriculture but rather intends to favor a holistic approach, which is based on their vision of bringing integrated development to vulnerable people from their base community, ie villages.
For CRS, if we strengthen communities in an integrated approach of social inclusion, community governance, sustainable agricultural production and livelihoods, the 99 targeted villages could have better food security.
CRS will collaborate with local NGOs and transfer skills to them in a responsible manner, with technical monitoring. CRS will apply the approach “Do not skip villages, do not forget villages, do not harm or create new imbalances between villages.”. Work with the 99 villages and strengthen the links not only at the level of governance and practices but also strengthen the links and exchanges with the state sectors and the different groups of producers between the different villages, who work in the different value chains.
Emphasis will be placed on the inclusion of women in governance and in all development activities.
The expected results are: - Communities are equipped to maintain social cohesion. - Community-level governance structures are strengthened, active, and connected to state services - Households adopt improved nutritional practices. Communities produce more food for consumption and sale. - Communities mobilize resources to access nutritious food. - (Cross-cutting): 99 villages prioritize gender inclusion at the community and household level. The total budget for the intervention is SEK 56 880 281 (USD $6 825 634 ). The Swedish Embassy will contribute 55,696,948.15 (USD 6 825 634 ) for the implementation of the intervention during the period 2021-2024, 98% of the total budget . The rest of the budget 1 183 333 , which indicates 2%, although minimal will be funded by CRS as research work on social cohesion. The Embassy is continuing the dialogue before signing the agreement to ensure that CRS will contribute up to 2%. CRS's contribution will be used specifically to carry out operational research to measure the impact of social cohesion programming included in the Tudikolela project.
